comment.author: 71758280@N00
comment._content: Possibly related to: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9501E0DA1630E233A... BURNS MEN HOLD TWO AS GUNMEN; Trail Pair from Albany to Fonda, N.Y., and Arrest Them as "Gyp" and "Lefty Louie." August 27, 1912, Tuesday William J. Burns, head of the National Detective Agency, employed by District Attorney Whitman to run down the two missing slayers of Herman Rosenthal, the gambler, announced shortly after midnight last night that two of his operatives had arrested two men earlier in the evening in Fonda, N.Y.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks!  Helpful connections; we'll fix the date and add a subject note.

comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: Below see link to Wikipedia article about Gyp, the Blood also known as Harry Horowitz. Horowitz and his gang were convicted and executed, apparently they were believed to be acting at behest of NYPD Police Lieutenant Charles Becker, and there are photos in this Flickr series of Becker going to Sing Sing also. (see tag for Becker). They killed Herman Rosenthal. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gyp_the_Blood

comment.author: 22795614@N06
comment._content: A distant great-uncle of mine was Frank Upton, the New York detective who arrested Lefty and Gyp. That *might* be him standing on the upper left. Anyone have an ID of the other men in the shot?
